definition[0]: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
example[1]: the camouflage netting over the tanks
definition[1]: the type of green and brown clothes, paint etc that soldiers wear to make themselves more difficult to see
example[2]: The men were dressed in camouflage and carrying automatic weapons.
definition[2]: the way that the colour or shape of an animal protects it by making it difficult to see in the area in which it lives
example[4]: The whiteness of the arctic fox acts as camouflage, hiding it from its enemies.
definition[3]: behaviour that is designed to hide something
example[5]: Aggression is often a camouflage for insecurity.
definition[4]: to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else
example[6]: The strain she was under was well camouflaged by skilful make-up.
example[7]: I saw a truck, heavily camouflaged with netting and branches.
